memberdef.name: camera_actions
memberdef.initializer: = { # camera moves by 3 world units. pygame.K_LEFT: point.Point(-3, 0), pygame.K_RIGHT: point.Point(3, 0), pygame.K_UP: point.Point(0, 3), pygame.K_DOWN: point.Point(0, -3), }

memberdef.name: cmd_group_keys
memberdef.initializer: = { pygame.K_0: 0, pygame.K_1: 1, pygame.K_2: 2, pygame.K_3: 3, pygame.K_4: 4, pygame.K_5: 5, pygame.K_6: 6, pygame.K_7: 7, pygame.K_8: 8, pygame.K_9: 9, }

memberdef.name: shortcuts
memberdef.initializer: = [ ("F1", "Select idle worker"), ("F2", "Select army"), ("F3", "Select larva (zerg) or warp gates (protoss)"), ("F4", "Quit the game"), ("F5", "Restart the map"), ("F7", "Toggle RGB rendering"), ("F8", "Toggle synchronous rendering"), ("F9", "Save a replay"), ("Ctrl++", "Zoom in"), ("Ctrl+-", "Zoom out"), ("PgUp/PgDn", "Increase/decrease the max game speed"), ("Ctrl+PgUp/PgDn", "Increase/decrease the step multiplier"), ("Pause", "Pause the game"), ("?", "This help screen"), ]

para.verbatim:
Create a renderer for use by humans.
Make sure to call `init` with the game info, or just use `run`.
Args: fps: How fast should the game be run. step_mul: How many game steps to take per observation. render_sync: Whether to wait for the obs to render before continuing. render_feature_grid: When RGB and feature layers are available, whether to render the grid of feature layers. video: A filename to write the video to. Implicitly enables render_sync.

Take the game info and the static data needed to set up the game.
This must be called before render or get_actions for each game or restart.
Args: game_info: A `sc_pb.ResponseGameInfo` object for this game. static_data: A `StaticData` object for this game.
Raises: ValueError: if there is nothing to render.
Initialize the pygame window and lay out the surfaces.
Zoom the window in/out.
Return a MousePos filled with the world position and surf it hit.
Get actions from the UI, apply to controller, and return an ActionCmd.
Return a `sc_pb.Action` with the camera movement filled.
Return a `sc_pb.Action` with the camera movement filled.
Return a `sc_pb.Action` with the selection filled.
Select an idle worker.
Select the entire army.
Select all warp gates.
Select all larva.
Act on a control group, selecting, setting, etc.
Return a `sc_pb.Action` filled with the cmd and appropriate target.
Get a length limited unit name for drawing units.
Draw the units and buildings.
Draw the selection rectange.
Draw the build target.
Draw the overlay describing resources.
Draw the help dialog.
Draw the list of available commands.
Draw the unit selection or build queue.
Draw the actions so that they can be inspected for accuracy.
Keep a list of the past actions so they can be drawn.
Draw the base map.
Draw the minimap.
Draw the rendered pixels.
Draw the screen area.
Draw a feature layer.
Push an observation onto the queue to be rendered.
A render loop that pulls observations off the queue to render.
Render a frame given an observation.

memberdef.argsstring: (self, run_config, controller, max_game_steps=0, max_episodes=0, game_steps_per_episode=0, save_replay=False)
memberdef.name: run

para.verbatim: Run loop that gets observations, renders them, and sends back actions.
Update the camera transform based on the new camera center.
Return the list of abilities filtered by `fn`.
A generator of visible units and their positions as `Point`s, sorted.
Return the list of units that intersect the rect.
Render starcraft obs with pygame such that it's playable by humans.
